id: algorithm for computing a credit rating
name: algorithm for computing a credit rating

id: rating scale for assigning a credit rating to individual, entity, or instrument, including defining a set of codes or numeric scores and indicating how an assessment that is assigned a score based on that scale means
name: rating scale for assigning a credit rating to individual, entity, or instrument, including defining a set of codes or numeric scores and indicating how an assessment that is assigned a score based on that scale means

id: report derived from the transaction history of a credit account
name: report derived from the transaction history of a credit account

id: indicates the party for which something is being or has been requested
name: indicates the party for which something is being or has been requested

id: request from a lender to a credit repository to obtain information regarding a prospective borrower's creditworthiness
name: request from a lender to a credit repository to obtain information regarding a prospective borrower's creditworthiness

id:
This ontology defines the concept of a credit rating, along with credit watch and outlook qualifying terms. There are credit ratings for individuals, for organizations and for instruments. 
		These are referenced extensively in the securities models but are also applicable to business entities generally and in the context of lending and account maintenance.
name:
This ontology defines the concept of a credit rating, along with credit watch and outlook qualifying terms. There are credit ratings for individuals, for organizations and for instruments. 
		These are referenced extensively in the securities models but are also applicable to business entities generally and in the context of lending and account maintenance.

id: notice on a credit report to alert a reviewer of special or exceptional information
name: notice on a credit report to alert a reviewer of special or exceptional information

id: or other negative credit events within the last several years
name: or other negative credit events within the last several years

id: a type corresonding to a family of credit scoring algorithms sharing common characteristics
name: a type corresonding to a family of credit scoring algorithms sharing common characteristics

id: Bond rating firms use different designations, often consisting of the upper- and lower-case letters to identify a bond's credit quality rating. 'AAA' and 'AA' (high credit quality) and 'A' and 'BBB' (medium credit quality) are considered investment grade. Credit ratings for bonds below these designations ('BB,' 'B,' 'CCC,' etc.) are considered low credit quality, and are commonly referred to as 'junk bonds.'
name: Bond rating firms use different designations, often consisting of the upper- and lower-case letters to identify a bond's credit quality rating. 'AAA' and 'AA' (high credit quality) and 'A' and 'BBB' (medium credit quality) are considered investment grade. Credit ratings for bonds below these designations ('BB,' 'B,' 'CCC,' etc.) are considered low credit quality, and are commonly referred to as 'junk bonds.'

id: investment credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an instrument, typically with some relationship to the creditworthiness of the issuer(s)
name: investment credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an instrument, typically with some relationship to the creditworthiness of the issuer(s)

id: assessment of creditworthiness of a borrower generally or with respect to a particular debt or financial obligation
name: assessment of creditworthiness of a borrower generally or with respect to a particular debt or financial obligation

id: On April 22, 2022, OppFi (NYSE:OPFI) was downgraded by Zacks Investment Research from a 'hold' rating to a 'sell' rating in a research report issued to clients and investors on Friday, Zacks.com reports.
name: On April 22, 2022, OppFi (NYSE:OPFI) was downgraded by Zacks Investment Research from a 'hold' rating to a 'sell' rating in a research report issued to clients and investors on Friday, Zacks.com reports.

id: Use dct:hasVersion to specify a version for the credit score model.
name: Use dct:hasVersion to specify a version for the credit score model.

id: This classification often refers to loans made to high-quality borrowers that are offered prime or relatively low interest rates. Prime loans have low default risk.
name: This classification often refers to loans made to high-quality borrowers that are offered prime or relatively low interest rates. Prime loans have low default risk.

id: classifier for credit reports, often available from multiple vendors
name: classifier for credit reports, often available from multiple vendors

id: classifier for debt instruments that are considered to be of high quality and have a low risk of default
name: classifier for debt instruments that are considered to be of high quality and have a low risk of default

id: credit rating that provides an opinion of the probability of an individual or organization going into default within a year
name: credit rating that provides an opinion of the probability of an individual or organization going into default within a year

id: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings in the lending market with respect to the quality of the credit
name: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings in the lending market with respect to the quality of the credit

id: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that are considered to be of high quality
name: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that are considered to be of high quality

id: relates something (e.g. a credit report or insurance policy) to the specific time period that it covers
name: relates something (e.g. a credit report or insurance policy) to the specific time period that it covers

id: This is typically provided by a credit rating agency but could be produced by an internal proprietary model as well.
name: This is typically provided by a credit rating agency but could be produced by an internal proprietary model as well.

id: Typically Alt-A mortgages are characterized by borrowers with less than full documentation, average credit scores, higher loan-to-values, and more investment properties and secondary homes.
name: Typically Alt-A mortgages are characterized by borrowers with less than full documentation, average credit scores, higher loan-to-values, and more investment properties and secondary homes.

id: rating agency that publishes reports assessing the creditworthiness of a borrower or legal entity, either generally or with respect to a specific obligation
name: rating agency that publishes reports assessing the creditworthiness of a borrower or legal entity, either generally or with respect to a specific obligation

id: indicates direction in which an investment credit rating is expected to move in cases where that rating is on watch
name: indicates direction in which an investment credit rating is expected to move in cases where that rating is on watch

id: Typically, a credit rating is provided as a detailed report based on the financial history of borrowing or lending and creditworthiness of the entity or person derived from income statements, historical records related to borrowing, etc. with an aim to determine their ability to meet debt obligations.
name: Typically, a credit rating is provided as a detailed report based on the financial history of borrowing or lending and creditworthiness of the entity or person derived from income statements, historical records related to borrowing, etc. with an aim to determine their ability to meet debt obligations.

id: A tradeline on a credit report refers to a specific credit account. Tradelines report snapshot details derived from a combination of account features and payment history, and are used by credit reporting agencies as inputs to the analysis process that determines a party's credit rating.
name: A tradeline on a credit report refers to a specific credit account. Tradelines report snapshot details derived from a combination of account features and payment history, and are used by credit reporting agencies as inputs to the analysis process that determines a party's credit rating.

id: branded credit report offered in the marketplace
name: branded credit report offered in the marketplace

id: indicates the expected outlook for the rated entity
name: indicates the expected outlook for the rated entity

id: credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an investment, including but not limited to an instrument or organization
name: credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an investment, including but not limited to an instrument or organization

id: Subprime refers to borrowers or loans, usually offered at rates well above the prime rate. Subprime lending is higher risk, given the lower credit rating of borrowers.
name: Subprime refers to borrowers or loans, usually offered at rates well above the prime rate. Subprime lending is higher risk, given the lower credit rating of borrowers.

id: credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an organization
name: credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an organization

id: report describing the creditworthiness and related credit attributes of a borrower
name: report describing the creditworthiness and related credit attributes of a borrower

id: classifier indicating whether a credit inquiry is a result of a borrower's direct authorization or by some indirect means
name: classifier indicating whether a credit inquiry is a result of a borrower's direct authorization or by some indirect means

id: Nonprime loans may be offered to individuals who are unable to qualify for a conventional loan.
name: Nonprime loans may be offered to individuals who are unable to qualify for a conventional loan.

id: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that are considered below-average quality, such as borrowers with a tarnished or limited credit history, and may be subject to higher than average interest rates
name: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that are considered below-average quality, such as borrowers with a tarnished or limited credit history, and may be subject to higher than average interest rates

id: classifier for mortgages that are considered to be riskier than prime quality but less risky than subprime quality
name: classifier for mortgages that are considered to be riskier than prime quality but less risky than subprime quality
